text: Pristina International Airport, also known as Adem Jashari International Airport, is the main airport of Kosovo. It is southwest of Pristina, the capital city. The airport was opened in 1965. It has undergone significant expansions and renovations over the years to accommodate the increasing air traffic demand. The airport serves as a hub for both domestic and international flights, connecting Kosovo with various destinations across Europe and beyond. It plays a crucial role in facilitating tourism, business, and travel for the people of Kosovo and visitors to the region. Category:Pristina Category:Airports in Europe
title: Pristina International Airport
